subject: Medicine
title: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A quick win: understand Alzheimer's Disease.

hook.text: Alzheimer's erases a lifetime of memories in reverse orderâ€”recent ones first, childhood ones last.

buildup.text: Amyloid plaques and tau tangles accumulate in the brain, destroying neurons and their connections.

discovery.text: The disease begins 20 years before symptoms appear. By diagnosis, massive damage has already occurred.

twist.text: Despite billions in research funding, no treatment has successfully reversed Alzheimer's progression.

climax.text: Early detection through blood tests and brain scans may allow future treatments to intervene before symptoms.

punchline.text: The cruelest disease steals who you are.

quiz.question: When does Alzheimer's disease actually begin?
options: The moment the first symptoms are noticed
Only after age 70 in most patients
